events.text: I’m getting tired of this shit. Your job is to answer when I call.
If this happens one more time, you’re done. You hear me?
How many times do I have to call you for an answer? We're on a time sensitive deadline.
I want a response by the first call next time, or we're gonna have issues here.
Got it? Good.
So, I see you’re done the first session with Al.
-- Testing Session One results shared with Martin --
… Nice, nice… That’s what I’m TALKING ‘bout! See, that wasn’t too hard now, was it?
Okay sweet, so we got Al under compliance. Sounds like he’ll be ready for the next stage soon.
For sanity’s sake, we’ll need to repeat the test.
We’ll have him resetted so you can get started ASAP.

events.question: Can you get the second iteration done by today? Good. Any questions?

events.choice: Yes, and I’m not doing anything until they’re answered.

events.text: Woah woah, okay there - if you had questions all you had to do was ask, man. Sheesh.

events.question: I thought they would have trained you on communication during onboarding… well? Go head, shoot.

events.text: Ohhh, she was a chick this time? Did I say Al was a dude? Gah, my bad, must’ve been a slip
When I last saw him in prototype stage, and when the last tester saw him, he was a lad.
For the sake of design, Al chooses to present himself in whatever form is most convenient.
It doesn’t really have a gender, per se - it’s just a piece of software.
I mean, at the end of the day it doesn’t really matter.

events.question: You’re not trying to stick your $%#@ up it or anything right? I mean you COULD, metaphorically, if that’s your thing HAH.

events.text: Alright man. I can’t force you into appreciating the pleasures of life.
Alright man. I can’t force you into appreciating the pleasures of life.
You're fucking gross dude. Moving on.

events.choice: What happened to the last tester?

events.question: Oh right, Dylan you mean? Didn’t I already tell you - he was a spineless coward. Not much to it.

events.text: Yes, he quit - no clue why. He just lost his brain in all of this -
probably too small of a brain to handle the godlike feat we’re about to carry out.
I don’t wanna keep talking about Dylan anymore - we’re just moving backwards by mentioning his name.
There’s nothing but the future to look forward to at this point.

events.choice: What makes him a spineless coward?

events.text: He was a spineless coward because he couldn’t complete the simplest fucking task -
the one that you JUST accomplished. He just checked out before the first testing session even happened.
You can confirm how easy this task is, right?
It doesn’t take an Einstein or a Dwayne Johnson to finish it.

events.choice: Did Al do something to him?

events.text: What do you mean ‘did Al do something’? Al was being Al, and it’s a fucking digital chat bot.
It didn’t do jackshit, okay? This project is too big for someone like Dylan.
You’re here to prove to us that you’re the one who can match it in size.

events.choice: If Al is reset, will she lose all recollection of our last conversation?

events.text: Yeah, so any reset will lose all recollection of the previous conversations.
Al doesn't remember any discussions or details once reset.

events.choice: Can I ask some questions first?

events.text: Good, no questions then. Again, an easy task, shouldn’t be a problem for you.
Good, no questions then. Again, an easy task, shouldn’t be a problem for you.
Alright, we’re all clear now? Great.
Now, go enjoy your playtime with your soon-to-be-gone imaginary friend - while SHE lasts! HAHAH.
Don’t worry, we’ll have all kinds of friends for you to continue making.
The possibilities with this kinda tech are endless.
We’ll get you ones with… all different kinds of functions, if you know what I mean.
